  • Method Details

    • index

      @GetMapping("/appliances") public java.util.List<Appliance> index​(@RequestParam(value="home_id",required=false) java.lang.Long homeId, @RequestParam(value="zone_id",required=false) java.lang.Long zoneId)
      Parameters:
      homeId - The Home who's appliances should be returned
      zoneId - The Zone who's appliances should be returned
      Returns:

    • store

      @PostMapping("/appliances/store") public net.minidev.json.JSONObject store​(@RequestBody java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> request)
      Create an appliance by passing in the name, type of appliance, as well as, optionally, the home or zone id it should belong to. If just a zone is passed the setter should resolve the home automatically.
      Parameters:
      request - JSON request body parsed into a map, can contain: type, name, home_id, zone_id
      Returns:
      JSONObject

    • update

      @PostMapping("/appliances/update") public net.minidev.json.JSONObject update​(@RequestParam("appliance_id") java.lang.Long applianceId, @RequestParam(value="state",required=false) java.lang.Integer state, @RequestParam(value="name",required=false) java.lang.String name, @RequestParam(value="zone_id",required=false) java.lang.Long zoneId)
      Modify the properties of a given appliance and presist changes to db
      Parameters:
      applianceId - ID of the appliance in question
      state - State to change the appliance to: 0/1 for off/on, or some int to represent a temperature
      name - New name to idenify the appliance by
      zoneId - ID of the zone to move the appliance too
      Returns:
      JSONObject
